_header: Were this winter away well would I ween
Title(s): The Taking of ‘Þe castell of Gynes’
_description: Laurence Minot, The Taking of ‘Þe castell of Gynes’ — forty long lines in 6-line stanzas (aaaabb)

BlCottGalEIX.First Lines:
War þis winter owaywele wald I weneþat somer suld
                    schew himin schawes ful scheneboth þe lely and þe
                    lipardsuld geder on a grene…
BlCottGalEIX.Last Lines:
…and len oure sir Edwardhis life wele to ledeþat he
                    may at his endinghaue heuin till his mede
BlCottGalEIX.Note:
Written in short lines, two MS lines per line of verse, such that only
                    even lines rhyme.
BlCottGalEIX.Attributed Title:
How gentill sir Edward with his grete engines / wan with his wight men
                    þe Castell of Gynes (rubric, by scribe, f. 57ra)
